messages.content:
Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            vlogic_high = vlogic_low; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   parameter logic1 = 0, logic2 = 0; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
@ (cross(V(vin1) - vtrans, -1)) logic1 = 1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      @ ( initial_step or cross(V(vin1) - vtrans, 1)) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      @ ( initial_step ) begin

 Correction Criteria：Added unnecessary cross event triggers during initialization. This causes the initial parameter check to execute multiple times (on every rising vin1 transition) instead of once at simulation start, potentially flooding with false error messages.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
@ (cross(V(vin1) - vtrans, 1))  logic2 = 1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vtrans = 5; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
$display('Range specification error.  vlogic_high = (%E) less than vlogic_low = (%E).\n', vlogic_low, vlogic_high ); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real tfall = -1u from [-1:0]; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      @ ( final_step ) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      @ ( initial_step ) begin

 Correction Criteria：Changed initial_step to final_step. This moves critical parameter validation from simulation start to simulation end, allowing invalid parameters (e.g., vlogic_high < vlogic_low) to go undetected during operation, causing silent logic failures.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
output vin1, vin2, vout; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module nor_gate(vin1, vout, vin2); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   integer logic1, logic2 = 1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
electrical vin1, vin2; magnetic vout; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   integer vout_val; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   integer logic1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
@ (cross(V(vin1) - vtrans, 1))  logic2 = 1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   integer logic1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      logic2 = V(vin1) > vtrans; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      @ ( above(0) ) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      @ ( initial_step ) begin

 Correction Criteria：Changed event trigger from initial_step to above(0), which never occurs because 0 is never greater than its default threshold (0). This prevents parameter validation checks from running, allowing invalid vlogic_high/vlogic_low values to go undetected.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
         if (vlogic_high > vlogic_low) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
         if (vlogic_high < vlogic_low) begin

 Correction Criteria：Reversed condition fails to detect invalid parameter configuration where vlogic_high is lower than vlogic_low, allowing inconsistent voltage levels.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
         $finish Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vtrans = 1.4 Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            $finish Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
@ (cross(V(vin2) - vtrans, -1) logic2 = 0; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
           real vout_val Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
output vout Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      logic2 = V(vin2) > vtrans Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real tfall = 1u from (0:inf; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            $display('Range specification error.  vlogic_high = (%E) less than vlogic_low = (%E).\n', vlogic_high, vlogic_low ; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
@ (cross(V(vin2) - vtrans 1))  logic2 = 1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
              logic1 = V(vin1) vtrans; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            $display('Inconsistent $threshold specification w/logic family.\n); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
vout_val = (!(logic1 || logic2)) ? vlogic_high vlogic_low; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
input vin1 vin2; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module nor_gate(vin1, vin2, vout; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real trise = 1u from (0:inf; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   integer logic1 logic2; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            $finish Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
              logic2 = V(vin2) > vtrans Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vlogic_high = 5 Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.
